column4: i'm trying to get my networking working. i can resolve dns correctly and ping addresses but i can't download a webpage. can anyone help me?
i've set a static ip via /etc/network/interfaces
did you set a gateway/route?
so you can resolve dns hosts? and you can ping them?
yes
so your problem is downloading something using wget?
yes, that's how i'm testing my access to the internet
what error does it give?
Connecting to 72.14.207.99:80... failed: Connection timed out.
this is a vm?
maybe your networking is broken or configured wrong
maybe, but i don't understand why i can ping external sites and resolve dns
what type of networking did you configure?
I originally set it up as dhcp and am now trying to configure a static ip because this vm is going into production, my networking is here: http://pastebin.com/mGh1QBqM
is that bridged network?

i'm using hyper-v so the terminology is a bit different. they call it 'external' which translates to this: 'Creates a connection to a physical network adapter so that virtual machines can access a physical network.'. I'm pretty sure the answer to your question is yes though
maybe some firewall blocks your traffic
never worked with hyper-v
i just used wget to download from an internal web server using it's FQDN
still that server has a different ip so it could still be some rule in your outbound firewall
yeah i agree with you
i'll speak to our ops guys about it. thanks for you help
